comment: SOP-003 review complete. Document aligns with CR-009 Section 5 approved outline. All required sections present: Purpose, Scope, Definitions, When to Create INV (with guidance, QA oversight, judgment role), Investigation Structure (Background, Evidence, Findings, RCA, CAPAs), CAPAs as Execution Items, and Closure Criteria. Section 6.3 explicitly states QA verification of CAPA child-CR completion occurs during INV post-review. Terminology consistent with SOP-001. Cross-references to SOP-001, SOP-002, and SOP-004 present. No procedural issues identified.

Review of SOP-003-draft.md v1.1. FRONTMATTER: title='Deviation Management' (present, non-empty); revision_summary='CR-016: Restructure INV content requirements (Section 5)' (present, begins with CR ID). STRUCTURE: All 9 sections present (Purpose, Scope, Definitions, When to Create an Investigation, Investigation Content Requirements, CAPAs as Execution Items, Investigation Workflow, Closure Criteria, References). CR-016 CHANGES VERIFIED: Section 5 restructured to define 10-section INV structure (Purpose, Scope, Background, Description of Deviation(s), Impact Assessment, Root Cause Analysis, Remediation Plan, Execution Comments, Execution Summary, References). PLACEHOLDERS: None found. FORMATTING: Consistent. VERDICT: COMPLIANT. Recommend approval.

REVIEW FINDINGS - SOP-003 (CR-039 Implementation)

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: 'Deviation Management' - PRESENT
- revision_summary: 'CR-039: Section 4 and Section 6 alignment corrections' - PRESENT, correctly references CR-039

CR-039 CHANGE VERIFICATION:
- Section 4: 'The project authority has discretion to determine when an INV is warranted.' - VERIFIED
- Section 6: 'CAPAs are not standalone documents. They are execution items within Investigations, identified in the execution table (e.g., CAPA-1, CAPA-2).' - VERIFIED

DEFICIENCY IDENTIFIED:

Section 3 (Definitions table) contains corrupted characters. The original effective SOP-003 contains proper em-dashes in the CAPA and INV definitions:
- Original: 'Corrective and Preventive Action — a category of execution item within an INV'
- Draft: 'Corrective and Preventive Action � a category of execution item within an INV'

The em-dash character (U+2014) has been corrupted to a replacement character (U+FFFD) in both the CAPA and INV definition rows.

REQUIRED CORRECTION:
Restore the em-dash characters in Section 3 Definitions table:
1. CAPA row: Replace '�' with '—'
2. INV row: Replace '�' with '—'

FINDING: NON-COMPLIANT

The document cannot be approved with corrupted characters. Please correct the encoding issue and re-route for review.

RE-REVIEW FINDINGS - SOP-003 (CR-039 Implementation)

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: 'Deviation Management' - PRESENT
- revision_summary: 'CR-039: Section 4 and Section 6 alignment corrections' - PRESENT, correctly references CR-039

- CAPA definition: 'Corrective and Preventive Action - a category of execution item within an INV' - No corrupted characters
- INV definition: 'Investigation - an executable document for analyzing deviations' - No corrupted characters

- Section 4: 'The project authority has discretion to determine when an INV is warranted.' - VERIFIED
- Section 6: 'CAPAs are not standalone documents. They are execution items within Investigations, identified in the execution table (e.g., CAPA-1, CAPA-2).' - VERIFIED

FORMATTING: Consistent throughout.

FINDING: COMPLIANT
